head.title: Times Square Tower For Accounting Firm

meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

hedline.hl1: Times Square Tower For Accounting Firm

block.p: Arthur Andersen, the accounting firm, has signed a lease with Boston Properties that would enable the developer to build a 47-story, $600 million skyscraper at the south end of Times Square. The building would be the last of four office towers at the core of a plan to transform Times Square from a dowdy and foreboding crossroads into a vibrant entertainment and commercial district.

Arthur Andersen, the accounting firm, has signed a lease with Boston Properties that would enable the developer to build a 47-story, $600 million skyscraper at the south end of Times Square. The building would be the last of four office towers at the core of a plan to transform Times Square from a dowdy and foreboding crossroads into a vibrant entertainment and commercial district.
